worldeditor

Class WorldEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • worldeditor.WorldEditor

  • public class WorldEditor
extends java.lang.Object
    World Editor class used to create the board that the game world is played on.
    Author:
    Jonathan Carr

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorldEditor()
      Constructor for WorldEditor, creates frame and toolselection windows.

      • processTile

        public void processTile(int i,
                        int j)
        Process a tile depending on the tool selected. Set tile, game object accordingly. also processes moving the world editor into and out of rooms.
        Parameters:
        i - x position of tile
        j - y position of tile

      • selectTile

        public void selectTile(Position selected)
        Set tile to selected in renderer (will show as highlighted white tile)
        Parameters:

      • selectLocation

        public void selectLocation(GameSystem.Direction dir)
        Set location to selected i nrenderer (will show as highlighted white location)
        Parameters:
        dir - - direction to select location from

      • clickLocation

        public void clickLocation(GameSystem.Direction dir)
        When clicking in direction adjacent to centered location, if no location exists add one. If location exists, center editor in that location.
        Parameters:
        dir - - direction to select location from

      • mergeMaps

        public java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,Location> mergeMaps(java.util.Map<java.awt.Point,Location> map1,

        Merge two maps of points to locations.
        Parameters:

        map2 - - second map
        Returns:
        merged map - merged map

      • getLocationAt

        public Location getLocationAt(int startingLoc,
                              GameSystem.Direction[] directions)
        Get location in a series of directions from the starting location.
        Parameters:
        startingLoc - - starting location
        directions - - array of directions
        Returns:
        target location - location after going through array of directions
